channel.title: Cool plugin (Been out for a while)
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HVBp7HOG78I
Can't remember if this was ever posted, but I'll post it again anyway!
:)

item.title: Cool plugin (Been out for a while)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

krackkid:

Coon had a personal webclient at one point. That me and him both where able to use, he would be the guy to ask o.o

Lol, it drew up issues though after mods are installed. I can however, start working on a custom launcher for moparcraft (if we need something like this) that would download and install the mods. However, we may need to keep the repository up on moparcraft for the updating and such, rather than rely on my own techniques. Mainly because my technique currently grabs the newest version if your version check fails, this would need a system so that nobody goes too far up-2-date.

Read full topic

It might work in smp if you replaced the bloack id’s with something not found naturally. Although things will look funky for others.

You would have to do that, but also everyone would have to use the same (modified) client.
[/quote]

Individual clients for everyone so they can see and use custom items? That sounds familiar…[/quote]

nah your just stupid theres no way that can be familiar

item.source: Cool plugin (Been out for a while)

item.title: Cool plugin (Been out for a while)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:15, topic:424649”]I voted ‘what are you? crazy? that’s a single player modication, not possible in SMP at all!’.

Obviously that is a single player modification, and it only works because in OpenGL you can set cameras and viewports where ever you want. It could never be a server plugin, because it’s entirely client-sided (maybe possible with Spout though…). Also, before you get too excited, it will only work on parts of the world currently being rendered. So the camera and TVs could only be as far as your render distance is set apart, probably a few chunks at most.

Sorry to burst everyone’s bubbles. :)[/quote]That would still be cool, because you could use it to monitor your property.

Read full topic

item.title: Cool plugin (Been out for a while)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I voted ‘what are you? crazy? that’s a single player modication, not possible in SMP at all!’.

Obviously that is a single player modification, and it only works because in OpenGL you can set cameras and viewports where ever you want. It could never be a server plugin, because it’s entirely client-sided (maybe possible with Spout though…). Also, before you get too excited, it will only work on parts of the world currently being rendered. So the camera and TVs could only be as far as your render distance is set apart, probably a few chunks at most.

Sorry to burst everyone’s bubbles.

Read full topic

item.title: Cool plugin (Been out for a while)
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

badger41:

then again the screen would be really small

06/21/2011: CCTV v2.2

  • You can now enter a custom screen size (in number of blocks) in the prop file for one of the screens
xx matty xx:

I think a more realistic idea would be to use fiber optics or something, rather than just a magical CCTV block that you can stick anywhere (unless I misunderstood).

Maybe it’s wireless!

New rule as well: Post what you voted, or the vote doesn’t count.

I voted yes!

I’m not going to add this to the OP so I can catch out people who don’t read the thread :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Looks interesting, would be better if they used the sign model instead of a block for the monitor so you could place it flat against a wall without putting it inside the wall, and also signs have a lot more rotation angles which would be very handy

then again the screen would be really small

item.title: Cool plugin (Been out for a while)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I think a more realistic idea would be to use fiber optics or something, rather than just a magical CCTV block that you can stick anywhere (unless I misunderstood).

For example, if you wanted to see into a cave you’d make a 1x1 tunnel of fiber optic blocks from the cave to your house and stick a viewing screen on the end. But then someone would have to program this, and everyone is lazy

Read full topic
